manageProject.activitybar.title: Manage Project
manageProject.commands.saveProject.title: Project Manager: Save Project
manageProject.commands.listProjects.titl: Project Manager: List Projects to Open
manageProject.commands.listProjectsNewWi: Project Manager: List Projects to Open in New Window

manageProject.commands.addToWorkspace.ti: Project Manager: Add Project to Workspace
manageProject.commands.editTags.title: Edit Tags

manageProject.configuration.title: Project Manager
manageProject.configuration.showProjectN: Should display the project name in the Status Bar?
manageProject.configuration.openInNewWin: Should the project be opened using a New Window when you click the Status Bar?
manageProject.configuration.removeCurren: Should the current project be hidden in the list of available projects?
manageProject.configuration.sortList.des: List the projects sorted by...(Saved, Name, Path or Recent)
manageProject.configuration.groupList.de: List the projects grouped by...(Favorites, VSCode, Git, Mercurial and SVN)
manageProject.configuration.projectsLoca: Indicates an alternative location where the `projects.json` file is stored
manageProject.configuration.vscode.baseF: Indicates the base folders to search for VSCode projects
manageProject.configuration.vscode.ignor: Indicates folders to be ignored, like "node_modules", "out", "typings", "test"
manageProject.configuration.vscode.maxDe: Indicates the maximum depth of folder recursion to search for projects. Any value below 1 means there is no limit
manageProject.configuration.git.baseFold: Indicates the base folders to search for Git projects
manageProject.configuration.git.ignoredF: Indicates folders to be ignored, like "node_modules", "out", "typings", "test"
manageProject.configuration.git.maxDepth: Indicates the maximum depth of folder recursion to search for projects. Any value below 1 means there is no limit
manageProject.configuration.hg.baseFolde: Indicates the base folders to search for Mercurial projects
manageProject.configuration.hg.ignoredFo: Indicates folders to be ignored, like "node_modules", "out", "typings", "test"
manageProject.configuration.hg.maxDepthR: Indicates the maximum depth of folder recursion to search for projects. Any value below 1 means there is no limit
manageProject.configuration.svn.baseFold: Indicates the base folders to search for SVN projects
manageProject.configuration.svn.ignoredF: Indicates folders to be ignored, like "node_modules", "out", "typings", "test"
manageProject.configuration.svn.maxDepth: Indicates the maximum depth of folder recursion to search for projects. Any value below 1 means there is no limit
manageProject.configuration.any.baseFold: Indicates the base folders to search for any folder projects
manageProject.configuration.any.ignoredF: Indicates folders to be ignored, like "node_modules", "out", "typings", "test"
manageProject.configuration.any.maxDepth: Indicates the maximum depth of folder recursion to search for projects. Any value below 1 means there is no limit
manageProject.configuration.cacheProject: Should cache the VSCode, Git and SVN projects found?
manageProject.configuration.ignoreProjec: Should ignore projects found inside other projects?
manageProject.configuration.checkInvalid: Should check for invalid paths before listing, showing a message below the project name?
manageProject.configuration.showParentFo: Should show the parent folder info when projects with same name are detected?
manageProject.configuration.filterOnFull: Should filter projects through full path?
manageProject.configuration.openInCurren: Indicates if the New Window command open the project in current window, when empty.
Indicates if the New Window command open the project in current window, when empty.
manageProject.configuration.confirmSwitc: Controls whether the extension should ask for confirmation when opening projects in the active window.
manageProject.configuration.tags.descrip: Indicates the list of tags you can use to organize your projects
